page.title: 11LOCAL EVENTS
page.content:
There are not many events that happen in Langtree but there has been a fascinating event lately. Many children and villagers have been involved in a pageant to celebrate the fact that the first Rector at Langtree Church(not dedicated) was appointed 700 years ago. The pageant was held in the Church and depicted life over the last 700 years in Langtree. The school children put on a display of research work into village history as part of the pageant and a Civil War cannon brought by the Sealed Knot Society was fired in the school playing field.
There are a number of fetes held in the village during the year where people gather to buy and sell.
